#Text=General Assembly elects Ban Ki-moon as next UN chief
#Text=Saturday , October 14 , 2006
#Text=South Korean Ban Ki-moon , 68 , has been endorsed unanimously by the general assembly to succeed Kofi Annan as the secretary-general of the United Nations , on October 13 .
#Text=He will take the position of Secretary General on January 1 .
#Text=When asked by assembly president Sheikha Haya Rashed Al Khalifa to adopt the resolution by an oral vote , the room filled with hundreds of diplomats and UN staff clapping loudly .
#Text=A formal vote was not conducted as the decision was unanimous .
#Text=She banged her gavel after the vote and said , " It is so decided .

#Text=This is a historic day for the organization as it continues to evolve and live up to the values and principles of the [ UN ] Charter .

_	_	_	_

#Text=At the time of the decision itself , the South Korean was the only candidate for the job - when informal polls were carried out within the UN , the other five individuals fared so badly that they all dropped out of the leadership race .

column1: #Text=" The true measure of success for the UN is not how much we promise , but how much we deliver for those who need us most . "
#Text=" The UN is needed now more than ever before . "

#Text=Mr. Ban , the first Asian Secretary General since U Thant from Burma , said he was committed to meeting U.N. Millennium Development Goals , expanding peace operations and dealing with threats posed by terrorism and weapons of mass destruction , HIV/AIDS and other pandemics , environmental degradation and protecting human rights .

#Text=He also mentioned reform of the UN , something the United States — which contributes the largest part of the budget of the UN , with 22 % , but also has arrears of 1.3 billion dollars — has long called for .
#Text=However , the new Secretary General made clear that any changes would occur at his own pace .
#Text=" We reform not to please others , but because we value what this organisation stands for , " he said .
#Text=" We cannot change everything at once .

#Text=But if we choose wisely , and work together transparently , flexibly and honestly , progress in a few areas will lead to progress in a few more .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Kofi Annan , 68 , described Ban as  a future secretary-general who is exceptionally attuned to the sensitivities of countries and constituencies in every continent .

#Text=A man with a truly global mind at the helm of the world 's only universal organisation .

_	_	_	_

#Text=He added that he wished Ban strength and courage as he prepared to take over the job and to  have fun along the way . "

column1: #Text=" We believe he is the right person to lead the United Nations at this decisive moment in its history , particularly as the UN struggles to fulfill the terms of the reform agenda that world leaders agreed to last fall , " U.S. Ambassador John R. Bolton told the assembly .
#Text=Israeli Ambassador Danny Gillerman said that it was good for Israel 's standing in the organization .

#Text=" If the secretary general is serious and fair and appoints underlings who are serious and fair , and the UN will be serious , clean and organized , this will be good for the Jews , " said Mr. Gillerman .
#Text=Mr Ban will hold the position for five years until the next election in 2011 .
